intro: Cacalia ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant features showy, blue to violet bell-shaped blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are oval and arranged oppositely along the stems. Cacalia ovalifolia is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
